file_content.text: You should leave. Now.
Intruder! We've been compromised!
Sir! Intruders!
Who the... impossible. Throw down your weapons, Republic scum! You have no idea what you've done, breaking in here.
I'm here for information. There's no need for violence.
Stay calm!
We're not here to fight. We just need some information.
Stay calm!
If you have questions, you can ask them from inside your detention cell.
I'm sorry, the guy at the front desk must have made a mistake.
Oops, wrong room.
You're caught. Don't even try to talk your way out of it.
I'm not here to play around. Surrender, or you're all dead.
Throw down your weapons!
Sir! Weren't you listening? We're not to initiate hostilities.
Easy, killer. We didn't come here to start a war.
We will never surrender to filth like you.
Final warning: Drop your weapons and surrender. Now.
Republic war droid M1-4X. I want to know how to find him.
Tell me where the droid is.
If I wanted you dead, I would've just slagged the whole casino. This is a social visit.
Just take it easy, will you?
This visit is over.
Havoc Squad never surrenders! Bring it on!
Forget it!
Sir! We cannot possibly--
What the hell do you think you're--
Try me, Imp slime. Show me what you've got.
Never!
Subdue the intruders, men. Use whatever force is--
Men, subdue the intruder at once.
Zardres? This is Andrik. We've got the last package, and we're heading for Objecti--oh. Oh, this is too much.
Shut up, Andrik! Can't you see we have a situation here?
Just tell me where to find M1-4X, and there won't be any trouble.
An easily solved situation.
The Empire does not negotiate with scum like you.
Is this any way to let your bosses treat you, Andrik?
These Imps aren't very polite.
Tavus is my boss. These Imps are just middle management. Soon-to-be-dead middle management, I'm guessing.
You're just in time to watch me kill your new pals, Andrik.
Good timing, traitor.
Have fun dying, Zardres. At least I'll have time to double our patrols while you and your men are being slaughtered.
Wh--what? Don't be ridiculous. We'll have this situation dealt with in mere moments.
Nah. In mere moments, you'll be dead and the "situation" will be headed my way. Nice knowing you.
That treacherous, disrespectful....
I just want to know where the war droid is. There's no need for a fight.
Can't we settle this peacefully?
Are you insane? Why would I even consider telling you?
It doesn't sound like Andrik cares about the Empire at all. Why protect him?
Tell me about it.
Andrik may be scum, but his droid's activities are useful to the Empire. I cannot allow you to impede their work.
Andrik isn't loyal to you or the Empire. He'll turn on you, just like he turned on the Republic.
You'll be betrayed.
You're right. Andrik is scum, unworthy of the Imperial resources that protect him.
You will find Captain Andrik and M1-4X in a facility deep within the Shadow Town district, unlocking the droid's full potential.
That machine's power core is capable of far more than your scientists thought possible. Soon, M1-4X will have shields and weapons more powerful than any other droid ever created.
Sounds like I'd better double-time it.
I should hurry.
You'll be too late to stop the droid--but you might at least manage to kill Andrik, which suits me.
What's so special about M1-4X?
How is that possible?
His power core is unique, a rare piece from a lost alien civilization. Fully charging it was beyond the abilities of the Republic's pathetic scientists.
That won't stop me.
Bravery is no match for technology. But I would consider it a favor if you butchered that fool Andrik before you are utterly annihilated.
Now go. You have what you wanted--leave before I change my mind.
Oh, and... tell Captain Andrik that it was nice knowing him, too. Farewell.
Neither of us wants to start a war. Just tell me what I need to know.
Please, see reason.
The Imperial military does not negotiate! Guards! Open fire!
I guess Andrik was right.
So be it. [Attack.]
For the Republic!
Enough talk. [Attack.]
Argh! R--return fire! Return fire!
Get out.
